meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm not saying I'm a gaming expert, but I do know that when it comes to roguelikes, I'm an aficionado of chaos. One Step From Eden, developed by YummyYummyTummy, is the perfect storm of speed, strategy, and spell-casting mayhem. This game has got me feeling like a groovy hippie from the '60s - peace out, my friends!

Let's start with the visuals; they're straight fire! The pixel art is so sharp, it'll make your eyes water (in a good way). The character designs are unique and memorable, like that one cousin at the family reunion who always wears the same Hawaiian shirt. You know, the one you can't forget.

Now, onto the gameplay. I'll admit; I was skeptical at first. The deck-building mechanic had me thinking, "Is this just a fancy card game?" But nope, it's so much more! It's like trying to solve a puzzle while riding a unicorn - fast-paced, unpredictable, and utterly mesmerizing.

The critics have spoken, and they're singing the praises of One Step From Eden. The Indie Game Website gave it a glowing review, calling it "nigh-perfect." IGN Japan and Screen Rant chimed in with their own 90-point reviews, praising its innovative blend of deck-building and real-time action. Even PC Invasion and GameGrin, who were a bit more critical, still found value in the game's unique features.

Of course, not everyone is having a groovy time. GameMAG thought the progress was too slow, while TheGamer wished for more rewarding progression. But hey, being different is what makes One Step From Eden special, right?

In conclusion, if you're looking for a roguelike that's off the beaten path (literally), One Step From Eden is the way to go. With its addictive gameplay, stylish visuals, and spellbinding soundtrack, this game will have you saying "peace out" in no time!
